website_summaries.verdict: The thin, light and fast Matebook X is a tempting MacBook alternative for Windows 10 fans.
pros: The Huawei Matebook X has a stylish aluminum design that impresses everyone who sees it
It has a Dolby Atmos audio system and its power button doubles as a fingerprint reader
cons: The US price is still not confirmed, configuration options are limited and it lacks a touchscreen

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing. Very beautiful laptop
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. Very beautiful laptop, one of the thinnest and most elegant. Fast and reliable Cons: Non touch screen. Battery life could be better Only 2 built in ports ( USB type C). Camera only 1megapixel! ( seriously huwaei?!!) Take home message. If you don't care about touch screen and you want a powerful yet thin, super elegant, light, laptop with amazing sound, quick finger prints reader then this is the best one you get.
customer_reviews.author: Xman38

customer_reviews.title: Awesome laptop; awesome price; awesome sound; awesome specs; awesome everything!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is incredible! The screen is beautiful with great contrast, colors, and sharpness. The laptop is fast; the sound is fantastic; and the looks of this machine is out of this world. I 100% recommend this product if you want something that is great to look at (the screen and the laptop), performs excellent for everyday tasks (I have not played any games, so I cannot comment on that), and sounds like you're in a theater when watching movies or listening to music. One awesome other thing is the fingerprint reader is incredible and can read your print with the briefest of taps.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Super thin and it looks like a macbook
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! Super thin and it looks like a macbook. The thin bezels makes this laptop even smaller and lighter. The screen is beautiful. Keyboard works well. Haven't had any issues with the touch pad. And the fingerprint sensor is lightning quick. Overall, the laptop is fast. It says cool most of the time if you're just surfing the web or something like that. The bottom can get quite warm even if the computer is just windows updating. However, no sound since it's fanless. I think if you bought this laptop that you probably weren't going to play intensive games on it. It does the internet surfing, writing documents, etc perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: silly goose

customer_reviews.title: Best ultrathin laptop out there
customer_reviews.text: The reviews I read and saw on Youtube plus owning the Mate 9 phone made this an easy purchase. The build quality and speed of logging in with the fastest fingerprint reader out there plus the sound quality will push Huawei past Samsung and even Apple. I bought a similar size samsung laptop for my niece and side by side the MateBook wins in every category. It's not a gaming laptop but it can handle everyday work so fast. It could be priced a little lower and be more competitive but I knew what I was getting. If you haven't thought about Huawei yet, you need to.
customer_reviews.author: BMCK

customer_reviews.title: This might be the best laptop I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: This might be the best laptop I’ve ever used. I was a strong ThinkPad user for over a decade but wanted to try something with a good screen for once. This is the best display I have ever seen on a mobile device and the 3:2 aspect ratio is perfect for work. I run without scaling for 12 hours a day and do not have eyestrain. I strongly prefer this even over my Retina MacBook 12 due to the aspect ratio and superior tactile response of the keyboard. My only complaint is that it scratches pretty easily even compared to the MacBook. Highest possible recommendation. If you are thinking about buying, do it. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jdk

customer_reviews.title: Build quality was really nice and the screen was beautiful for the price
customer_reviews.text: Build quality was really nice and the screen was beautiful for the price. But unfortunately there was literally zero spacer between the glass and the body of the laptop - meaning the glass would probably shatter with extremely little impact even with the device closed. The trackpad was also really bad. Oh well - I wanted to love it. Got a Dell Inspiron 13” instead for hundreds less and it’s just as powerful with a touchscreen/convertible option too. Screen isn’t quite as nice and it’s a bit heavier but also way more durable. I would look elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Overall but not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Initial thoughts: This is a fantastic computer. The keyboard is great to type on. The build quality overall is excellent. It's definitely a great value for the price. There are only two things that I don't like about this model. Firstly, it doesn't have an embedded SD card reader. The laptop is thin, but one could have been included. For most people, this is a very minor issue. Secondly, and far more importantly to most users, the screen is EXTREMELY glossy. I prefer matte screens, but it's hard to find them nowadays. If the screen wasn't so obscenely glossy, this would be a five-star computer. I can't give half-stars, so take my rating as 4 and 1/2.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!

I only rated one because Huawei supports Office 365 by including their product to cheat the customer. After my 1 year "free" subscription expired it disabled my Microsoft Word. So instead of buying the product once (because you bought it when you bought the computer) they got greedy and make you subscribe every single year just so you can use Word, Excel, Power Point, etc. I can't even type or copy paste, all I can do is view my documents. If I had known about this scam I would have never bought this product! Completely dissatisfied customer!

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE-Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived malfunctioning. When the cursor was on the start menu, the screen would flash rapidly. Could not get it to stop. Probably an intermittent connection somewhere inside the computer. Also, buyer beware that the compuetr only has one output. But it does ship with an adapter that converts the single output to HDMI, RGB and USB outputs. Same adapter can be purchased on Amazon for $10-$15. So if you are planning to use it with a projector or anything that needs an HDMI or regular USB, you have to drag around the adapter with you.

product_meta.title: Huawei MateBook X Signature Edition Ultraslim Laptop, 13" QHD (2K), Intel Core i7-7500U, 8GB RAM, 512GB SSD, Fingerprint, Office 365 Personal, MateDock v2.0, Prestige Gold
product_meta.description: CPU:Intel core i7 8+512| Style:Prestige GoldAt just 12.5mm thick and 2.31 lbs., the HUAWEI Mate Book X challenges what it means for a notebook to be thin, light, and finless.
